wind_info: Vindhastighet m√§ts genom att medelv√§rdet av vindens hastighet tas √∂ver en viss tidsperiod. Vindbyar √§r pl√∂tsliga vind√∂kningar som vanligtvis varar i mindre √§n tjugo sekunder.

uv_index_info: UV-indexet m√§ter styrkan p√• solens ultravioletta (UV) str√•lning. Det anges p√• en skala fr√•n 0 till 11, d√§r h√∂gre v√§rden indikerar starkare UV-str√•lning.
uv_index_info_2: UV-str√•lning kan orsaka solbr√§nna, hudcancer och √∂gonskador. Ju h√∂gre UV-index, desto st√∂rre √§r risken f√∂r dessa problem.
uv_index_info_3: 1‚Äì2: L√•gt. Inget skydd beh√∂vs. Du kan vistas utomhus s√§kert med minimalt solskydd.
uv_index_info_4: 3‚Äì7: M√•ttligt till h√∂gt. Skydd beh√∂vs. S√∂k skugga fr√•n sen f√∂rmiddag till mitten av eftermiddagen. N√§r du √§r utomhus, applicera rikligt med solskydd med SPF 15 eller h√∂gre p√• oskyddad hud, och b√§r skyddande kl√§der, en bredbr√§ttad hatt och solglas√∂gon.
uv_index_info_5: 8+: Mycket h√∂gt till extremt. Extra skydd kr√§vs. Var f√∂rsiktig utomhus, s√§rskilt fr√•n sen f√∂rmiddag till mitten av eftermiddagen. Om din skugga √§r kortare √§n du sj√§lv, s√∂k skugga och b√§r skyddande kl√§der, en bredbr√§ttad hatt och solglas√∂gon, samt applicera rikligt med solskydd med minst SPF 15 p√• oskyddad hud.

pressure_info: Atmosf√§riskt tryck, √§ven k√§nt som lufttryck eller barometriskt tryck, √§r det tryck som jordens atmosf√§r ut√∂var ned√•t mot jordytan. Denna app anv√§nder medeltryck vid havsytans niv√• (MSLP).

moon_info: New Moon: When the moon is not visible because it is located between the Earth and the Sun. Illumination: 0%.
moon_info_2: Waxing Crescent: When a small sliver of the moon becomes visible, growing larger each night after the new moon. Illumination: 1%‚Äì49%.
moon_info_3: First Quarter: When half of the moon's face is illuminated, occurring approximately one week after the new moon. Illumination: ~50%.
moon_info_4: Waxing Gibbous: When more than half of the moon is illuminated, leading up to a full moon. Illumination: 51%‚Äì99%.
moon_info_5: Full Moon: When the entire face of the moon is illuminated by the Sun, appearing as a complete circle. Illumination: 100%.
moon_info_6: Waning Gibbous: When the moon begins to shrink after a full moon, but more than half of it remains illuminated. Illumination: 99%‚Äì51%.
moon_info_7: Last Quarter: When half of the moon's face is illuminated again, occurring approximately one week after the full moon. Illumination: ~50%.
moon_info_8: Waning Crescent: When only a small sliver of the moon remains visible before the new moon. Illumination: 49%‚Äì1%.
moon_info_9: Illumination: The percentage of the moon‚Äôs surface that is lit by the Sun, which varies depending on the phase of the moon.

aqi_info_us: Det amerikanska luftkvalitetsindexet, AQI (Air Quality Index) √§r ett m√•tt som anv√§nds f√∂r att visa hur f√∂rorenad luften √§r. Skalan g√•r fr√•n 0 till 500 ‚Äì ju h√∂gre v√§rde, desto s√§mre luftkvalitet.
aqi_info_eu: EU:s luftkvalitetsindex, AQI (Air Quality Index) √§r ett m√•tt som anv√§nds f√∂r att visa luftkvaliteten inom Europeiska unionen. Den delas in i fem niv√•er ‚Äì fr√•n ‚ÄùBra‚Äù till ‚ÄùMycket d√•lig‚Äù ‚Äì baserat p√• koncentrationen av de vanligaste luftf√∂roreningarna.

precip_info: Rain amount describes how much rain is expected, typically given in millimeters (mm) or inches. It helps indicate the intensity of rainfall ‚Äî from light showers to heavy downpours.
precip_info_2: Rain probability shows the chance of precipitation occurring at a given time and location, expressed as a percentage. For example, a 70% chance means rain is likely in that area.
precip_info_3: Rain duration indicates the total number of hours during the day that rain is expected. This helps estimate how long the weather might stay wet or overcast.
precip_info_4: Rain intensity measures how heavy the rain is during a given period, typically classified as light, moderate, or heavy. Heavier rainfall can lead to flooding or reduced visibility.

model_disc_2: Global forecast by ECMWF, slightly lower resolution, highly reliable worldwide.
model_disc_3: High-resolution version of ECMWF‚Äôs global model. Known for top accuracy globally.
model_disc_4: Chinese national model from CMA. Good for Asia-Pacific, less accurate globally.
model_disc_5: Global model from Australia's Bureau of Meteorology. Best for Australia & Oceania.
model_disc_6: Regional model optimized for Norway and Scandinavia. Very accurate for the Nordic region.
model_disc_7: NOAA‚Äôs blended high-res + global forecast. Balanced accuracy with faster updates.
model_disc_8: NOAA‚Äôs global model. Fast, free, decent worldwide but less precise locally.
model_disc_9: Ultra high-res short-range US model. Best for hyperlocal US forecasts (0‚Äì18h).
model_disc_10: AI-powered forecast by Google DeepMind. Experimental, smooth & cutting-edge globally.
model_disc_11: Blended Japan Meteorological Agency model. Accurate in Japan & East Asia.
model_disc_12: High-res short-range forecast for Japan. Great for 0‚Äì36h predictions in Japan.
model_disc_13: Japan‚Äôs global forecast model. Lower res but reliable in Asia-Pacific.
model_disc_14: German Weather Service‚Äôs blended ICON model. Good balance for Europe
model_disc_15: Global version of ICON. Precise forecasts worldwide, especially Europe.
model_disc_16: High-res regional ICON for Europe. Best for central & western Europe.
model_disc_17: Ultra high-res short-term forecast for Germany. Ideal for next 24‚Äì48h in DE.
model_disc_18: Environment Canada‚Äôs blended forecast. Good across North America.
model_disc_19: Canada‚Äôs global model. Reliable for global forecasts, better in northern latitudes.
model_disc_20: Canadian regional model. High detail for local areas in Canada.
model_disc_21: Ultra high-res Canadian model. Best for pinpoint weather in Canada & nearby US.
model_disc_22: Blended national model. Accurate in France & nearby countries.
model_disc_23: Global model from France. Decent worldwide, especially for French territories.
model_disc_24: Europe-focused ARPEGE. More precise than global version.
model_disc_25: High-res national model. Best for local French forecasts.
model_disc_27: High-resolution ICON model tailored by ARPAE for Italy. Ideal for detailed regional forecasts.
model_disc_28: Integrated multi-scale forecast system combining global and regional models for smooth transitions.
model_disc_29: Global model with 10km resolution. Suitable for medium-range international forecasts.
model_disc_30: High-resolution 2km model focused on the UK. Excellent for local short-term forecasting.

kmni_desc_1: Blended system integrating KNMI and ECMWF data for seamless global-to-local forecasts across scales
kmni_desc_2: High-resolution convection-permitting model covering Europe. Ideal for regional weather events and mesoscale features
kmni_desc_3: Ultra-high-resolution model focused on the Netherlands. Excellent for detailed local forecasts including precipitation and wind.
use_ai_for_summary_sub: GPT-4o Mini generates summaries of hourly, daily, and current weather, refreshing every 2 hours
